programmes.show_description: NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
Discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden in Uda - here the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule as a sanctuary of local culture and history.
Shirabu Onsen: A 700-year-old hot spring, Shirabu Onsen is maintained via daily trips up the slopes of the 2,000-metre mountain where it sits - see the spring's guardian at work in gorgeous footage.
Through songs rooted in local communities, Alfie Goodrich explores Hokkaido's history, culture and traditions.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
Hakodate and Asahikawa ramen, enjoy a hot helping of both! College kids give their all to a summer of ramen.
We travel to Rebun - a remote Hokkaido island renowned for its kombu, the seaweed vital for Japanese dashi - to meet a passionate harvester whose kombu is utilised by Chef Kuwakino in superb cuisine.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
Kerosene home delivery is a key lifeline for residents of Sapporo, Hokkaido. For three days in midwinter, we followed trucks delivering this heating oil and spoke to people who rely on this service.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

Faecal microbiota transplantation transfers gut bacteria from a healthy donor's stool into a patient's colon - it is being explored as a treatment for ulcerative colitis, Parkinson's disease and ADHD.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
What's next for Japan-US innovation? Miura Satoshi, the president of JETRO New York, offers his insights into the future of partnerships.
Instead of throwing away things that are old or broken, Japan fixes and reuses them with the culture of 'mottainai' - let's dig a little deeper.
Traditional techniques and resourceful recipes in just five minutes! Chefs Saito and Rika present their unique approaches to cooking delicious Japanese food.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
Through songs rooted in local communities, Alfie Goodrich explores Hokkaido's history, culture and traditions.
This daily news programme picks up the key news stories of the past 24 hours from Japan and around Asia.
We travel to Rebun - a remote Hokkaido island renowned for its kombu, the seaweed vital for Japanese dashi - to meet a passionate harvester whose kombu is utilised by Chef Kuwakino in superb cuisine.
This daily news programme picks up the key news stories of the past 24 hours from Japan and around Asia.
Kerosene home delivery is a key lifeline for residents of Sapporo, Hokkaido. For three days in midwinter, we followed trucks delivering this heating oil and spoke to people who rely on this service.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
What's next for Japan-US innovation? Miura Satoshi, the president of JETRO New York, offers his insights into the future of partnerships.

programmes.show_name: Bosai: Science That Can Save Your Life
programmes.show_description: We look at how Sendai has transformed into a disaster-resilient city with its 'multiple defences', countermeasures taken in its coastal area to minimise damage from a tsunami.
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

Faecal microbiota transplantation transfers gut bacteria from a healthy donor's stool into a patient's colon - it is being explored as a treatment for ulcerative colitis, Parkinson's disease and ADHD.
An evening news bulletin that provides Japan's views on many domestic and international news events.
Through songs rooted in local communities, Alfie Goodrich explores Hokkaido's history, culture and traditions.
This programme gives you comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia, explaining the day's developments and what is behind them.
In July 2025, Hayashi Hisashi became the first Japanese winner of a prestigious German award for the best board game of the year - how does he design games that captivate players around the world?
In 2023, one in 27 children in Japan was not attending school - a record high - but children at one free school enjoy themselves. Seeing them thrive reminds adults to see matters from a child's view.
Oshi-Katsu is the fan support of idols / characters through real and social means - with one in five Japanese adults taking part, we explore how this zealous fandom gives life purpose to one woman.
A Bedtime Routine: On hot and humid summer nights, nothing can get in the way of sleep like mosquitoes - we learn about the tools Edo townspeople had at their disposal to fight these pesky insects.
